required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TROLLEY Study - TRansit Opportunities for HeaLth, Livability, Exercise and EquitY
clinical_study.official_title: TROLLEY Study - TRansit Opportunities for HeaLth, Livability, Exercise and EquitY

brief_summary.textblock: The researchers are evaluating longitudinal changes in multiple health, economic, and environmental outcomes over a 3-year COVID recovery period and in the context of a new light rail transit (LRT) line, called the Mid-Coast Trolley, among 465 UC San Diego (UCSD) staff. The primary aim is to evaluate change in objectively measured total and moderate to vigorous physical activity (MVPA), travel mode, and vehicle miles traveled (VMT).

study_pop.textblock: We will study UCSD staff. We will aim to recruit 50% from people of color, and 50% low income (<80% Area Median Income), 50% female, and 50% living within 1 mile of a transit stop that connects to the Mid-Coast Trolley.
